It was great for years and we had no problems. Suddenly, twice in as many weeks, the drivers have lost the ability to: 1)read an address 2)read directions provided in app 3)deliver the package while standing at the address, in front of our doorbell camera and looking directly at the apt #. 4)knock or ring the bell. *I have come to the conclusion that, at least on the weekends, your driver's are leaving their brains at home. Please remind them to bring their brains to work, even on the weekends.
amazon prime said a package was artiving by 2pm. its almost 3 hours later and it never got here. whats the use of paying for prime when packages are late every single time. cmon man

While I appreciate the ease of price shopping and variety... Amazon really needs to work on their delivery and chat. More often than not, my shipments are delivered to the wrong address even with detailed instructions a toddler could follow. The AI chat has been completely useless. I'm not sure why they even bother with it other than to frustrate customers to give up. I'm far too stubborn for that. If not for the access to the wide array of products.. I would not be a Prime Customer.

I love Amazon but the one thing I wish they would change in the app is all the items in your cart, if you could check multiple cart items at once and move to your named/ saved shopping list because otherwise it's very time consuming.

almost half the things on searches that I WANT to buy, when I click to view I see a dog and message saying 'UH-OH, something went wrong on our end' and it never goes right again, even if I check frequently. otherwise enjoy window shopping and buying with this app.
